text: Mark Douglas Mark Douglas (September 19, 1829 - September 12, 1900) was an American farmer, businessman, and politician. Douglas was born in Dumfries, Scotland, the son of Thomas Douglas and Jane Dalrymple Douglas."Wisconsin, Death Records, 1867-1907," database, FamilySearch (https://familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:XLFT-62V : 10 March 2018), Mark Douglas, 1900; citing Death, Melrose, Jackson, Wisconsin, Wisconsin State Historical Society, Madison; FHL microfilm 1,310,188. He emigrated to the United States in 1845 and settled in the town of Melrose, Wisconsin Territory. He was a farmer, and in the logging and lumber business. He was postmaster of Melrose, Wisconsin and served as chairman of the town board. He served in the Wisconsin State Assembly in 1874 and the Wisconsin State Senate in 1876 and 1877 as a Republican.Wisconsin Blue Book, 1877, Biographical Sketch of Mark Douglas, p. 455. He also served on the Wisconsin Fish Commission. He died in Melrose, Wisconsin.Proceedings of the State Historical Society of Wisconsin at the Forty-Eighth Meeting, December 13, 1900, Biographical Sketch of Mark Douglas, p. 95. ==Notes== ==External links== * Category:People from Dumfries Category:People from Jackson County, Wisconsin Category:Scottish emigrants to the United States Category:Farmers from Wisconsin Category:Businesspeople from Wisconsin Category:Wisconsin Republicans Category:Mayors of places in Wisconsin Category:Wisconsin state senators Category:Members of the Wisconsin State Assembly Category:1829 births Category:1900 deaths Category:19th-century American politicians
